techmeme.title: The US NLRB says Google is a "joint employer" of ~50 Accenture Flex workers who joined the Alphabet Workers Union in 2023 and must bargain with their union (Daniel Wiessner/Reuters)
Tencent repurchased 3.93M Hong Kong-listed shares, worth ~$193M, on January 7, its largest buyback since April 2006, following its addition to a US blacklist (Charlotte Yang/Bloomberg)
Docs: The Heritage Foundation plans to "identify and target" volunteer Wikipedia editors who it says are "abusing their position" to publish antisemitic content (Arno Rosenfeld/The Forward)
Meta's fact-checking partners PolitiFact and FactCheck.org say they had no role in deciding what the company did with fact-checked content, denying Meta's claim (Stuart A. Thompson/New York Times)
Ten current and former Meta employees share frustrations over Meta's surrender to the right on speech issues; one called the changes "a precursor for genocide" (Casey Newton/Platformer)
